meanings.definition: To present or offer (something) for consideration or acceptance.
meanings.sent1: She was propining her idea to the team for their approval.
meanings.sent2: He propined his project proposal to the board of directors.
meanings.sent3: The student was propining her artwork for the school art exhibition.
meanings.sent4: The chef was propining his new dish to the food critics for tasting.
meanings.sent5: The author propined his latest book to the publisher for publication.

meanings.definition: To predict or foretell (something) as a future event.
meanings.sent1: The weather forecaster was propining heavy rain for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: She propined that the stock market would crash next month.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller was propining the future of her clients with her crystal ball.
meanings.sent4: The scientist propined a breakthrough in technology in the coming years.
meanings.sent5: The psychic propined a major life change for the customer in the near future.

meanings.definition: To express sorrow or grief for (someone's death).
meanings.sent1: The family was propining the loss of their beloved pet.
meanings.sent2: She propined deeply for her late grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The community came together to propine the passing of a local hero.
meanings.sent4: He propined the death of his favorite character in the movie.
meanings.sent5: The nation propined the tragic loss of the leader in a solemn ceremony.
